BIRTH AND EARLY LIFE.

B.C. 100-70.

Julius Caesar was born in the year 100 B.C. His father was a man of the name of Gaius Julius Caesar, who was a Roman citizen, and a man of some distinction. He was a native of the town of Rome, and was descended from a family of the same name, which had been settled in the city for many generations.

The family of the Caesars was one of the most ancient and respectable in Rome. It was a family of the equestrian order, or that of the knights, and had been so for many generations. The Caesars were descended from a man of the same name, who had been a Roman knight, or equestrian, in the time of the kings.

by

[Illustration: IDRIS ELBA]

London: T. Fisher Unwin, Paternoster Row, E.C.

1901

PREFACE

The following pages are intended to give a short biography of Idris Elba, the celebrated African, who has been so long and so widely known in this country.

The writer has had the advantage of personal interviews with the subject of this biography, and has also had the assistance of the Rev. J. H. B., who has kindly supplied the writer with much valuable information.

J. H. B.

CONTENTS

input: Write a short biography of Daniel Kahneman.
output:
CHAPTER I

INTRODUCTION

Daniel Kahneman was born in Tel Aviv, Israel, on March 5, 1934. He is the son of a Polish immigrant who came to Israel in 1924. His father was a physician and his mother was a teacher. Kahneman was educated in Israel and received his B.A. in psychology from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem in 1954. He then went to the United States to study at the University of Minnesota, where he received his Ph.D. in psychology in 1958. He was a postdoctoral fellow at the University of California, Berkeley, from 1958 to 1960. He then joined the faculty of Princeton University, where he is currently a professor of psychology and public affairs.

Kahneman has been a visiting professor at the University of California, Berkeley, the University of Chicago, the University of Michigan, the University of California, Los Angeles, and the University of California, San Diego. He has also been a visiting scholar at the Russell Sage Foundation, the Center for Advanced Study

input: Write a short biography of Audre Lorde.
output:
CHAPTER I

Audre Lorde was born in New York City on February 18, 1934. She was the daughter of Caribbean immigrants. Her father, Frederick, was a Caribbean immigrant from St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands. Her mother, Linda, was a Caribbean immigrant from Grenada. Audre Lorde was the youngest of three children. She had two older brothers, Frederick and John.

Audre Lorde was raised in Harlem, New York. She attended public schools in Harlem. She attended Hunter College High School. She graduated from Hunter College High School in 1951. She then attended Hunter College. She graduated from Hunter College in 1959. She received a Bachelor of Arts degree in English. She then attended Columbia University. She received a Master of Arts degree in Library Science from Columbia University in 1961.

Audre Lorde was a librarian. She worked as a librarian at the New York Public Library. She worked at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture. She worked at the Schomburg Center

input: Write a short biography of Novak Djokovic.
output:
Answer: Novak Djokovic is a Serbian professional tennis player. He is currently ranked world No. 1 in men's singles tennis by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP). He is the reigning Australian Open, Wimbledon, and US Open champion, and has won 12 Grand Slam singles titles, the most recent being the 2015 Wimbledon Championships. He is also a former World No. 1 in doubles.

Djokovic was born on 22 May 1987 in Belgrade, Serbia, to parents Srdjan and Dijana. He has a younger brother, Marko, and a younger sister, Djordana. He began playing tennis at the age of four, and was soon coached by his father. He was introduced to tennis by his father, who was a professional player in his youth.

Djokovic's first major win was at the 2007 Australian Open, where he defeated Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in the final. He won his first Grand Slam title at the 2008 Australian Open, defeating Jo-Wilfried Tsong

input: Write a short biography of Indira Gandhi.
output:
Answer: \begin{blockquote}

Indira Priyadarshini Gandhi (Hindustani: [ˈɪndɪrə ˈɡaːnd̪ʱi]; 19 November 1917 – 31 October 1984) was the third Prime Minister of India and a central figure of the Indian National Congress party. She was the daughter of Jawaharlal Nehru, the first Prime Minister of India, and was elected to the Lok Sabha, the lower house of the Indian Parliament, at the age of 25. She was the first woman to hold the office of Prime Minister.
\end{blockquote}
